title: Creating an Equation
text: If we let $$n$$ be an odd number, then we know that $$n\left(n+2\right)=255$$. We can simplify this to get $$n^2+2n-255=0$$.
speech: If we let  n  be an odd number, then we know that , n, parentheses n plus 2,  is equal to 255 . We can simplify this to get  n squared, plus 2 n minus 255 is equal to 0 .

title: Solving the Equation
text: Using the quadratic formula, we get $$n=15$$ and $$n=-17$$. We can remove the negative solution. So, the two consecutive odd numbers are $$15$$ and $$17$$.
speech: Using the quadratic formula, we get  n is equal to 15  and  n, is equal to, negative 17 . We can remove the negative solution. So, the two consecutive odd numbers are  15  and  17 .
